creator.name: Financiële administratie van Suriname
creator.his_func: The administration of finances in Suriname was spread across different offices (comptoirs), depending on the type of function or the tax. There were, for example: a recipient of modest charges (1682) to help pay the expenses of the government in the colony; a recipient of poll tax (1682); a recipient of the fund against runaway slaves (1750). Planters had a mandatory contribution to pay, related to the number of slaves they owned. Major changes in this situation first came in 1828 when a division was made between general and colony-wide charges and special or municipal taxes.
